alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Union; Hudson (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN UNION, SOUTHEASTERN ESSEX, RICHMOND, AND HUDSON COUNTIES THROUGH 100 PM... At 1214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a developing strong thunderstorm over Edison, or near New Brunswick, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Linden around 1235 PM EDT. Elizabeth and Port Richmond around 1245 PM EDT. Newark and Bayonne around 1250 PM EDT. Jersey City, Harrison and Kearny around 1255 PM EDT. Battery Park around 100 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Roselle, Rahway, East Newark and Heartland Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
